website_summaries.verdict: The Meramac tent features a freestanding, 2-pole design. Made with a lightweight yet strong polyester fabric, the side walls of this tent are uncoated to give more ventilation inside the tent. The fly uses a pole in the top to give you an awning over each door for added rain protection. A great tent for a camping trip!
pros: 2 zippered windows and large mesh panels provide great ventilation
Polyester fly resists water and UV damage
cons: A bit heavier and might be tight for 2 large adults

customer_reviews.title: The ALPS tent here is very easy to set up and one person definitely can set ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this tent as a backup to our other tent (that is impossible to put up alone). The ALPS tent here is very easy to set up and one person definitely can set it up. If you don't use any air mattresses, this tent will work. Our air mattresses don't quite fit but we make it work. The tent is light weight (unless you're a die hard backpacker), has nice ventilation, and is everything you'd like in a basic tent at a reasonable price point. Have used it 3 times and am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it, you'll love it
customer_reviews.text: So great! And so easy to put up. Took me like 10minutes max. Very nice and sleek design. And the rain fly literally snaps onto the tent. Which makes it really convenient when you're in a hurry. Not as light as I thought so instead of having it on my pack I just carried it the mile to the campsite for balance. It's really easy to fold if you follow the crease lines. I've used it twice and haven't had any problems fitting it back into the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: It worked. The inside stayed dry, blocked the wind, and didn't condensate or get overly humid. I highly suggest a tarp under the tent, however no moisture made it into the tent through several nights of rain and sleet and whatever else falls out of the sky in Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I set this tent up with out looking at any instructions and didn't have any problems. It rained pretty hard for a few hours of the night and not one drop of water came in the tent. It will fit a single airmattress...so I would say this is more like a one person tent!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Floor
customer_reviews.text: Floor leaks heavily, the first time I used this it rained lightly and I woke up to a pool of water. I called ALPS Mountaineering for a warranty and they told me they would send me a new tent after I emailed them with pictures of the tent, but I have not heard back after sending multiple emails in over a month. I have an old ALPS tent that has been through hell and back, but I guess they’re getting cheap with they’re manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Colton K.

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: Great ventilation and dry when set up properly. I have been around the sun 75 times and OCD with my camping equipment. Here in the Tennessee mountainous range my tent has been tested in severe weather conditions, heavy blowing winds and cold. I don’t like rain and cold on me. I woke up dry and warm. Not really enough space for two with gear inside. Having two exits is a plus. If this tent fails it will be my fault. (unless a widow maker lands on it)
customer_reviews.author: "Tex"

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little backpacking tent.
customer_reviews.text: It's light, packs small and it's very affordable. An excellent value for the money. I really like that the poles do not have to be slid through sleeves but instead hold the tent up by clips. The tent goes up fast and comes down fast.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Buchholz

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little tent. Roomy for a child and adult. Just right for two average sized adults. With the rain fly on, it's snug enough to keep some heat in on a chilly night. With the opposing doors/windows, you also get a nice breeze when you want it. It's not the cheapest tent out there, but it's also not the priciest. It's a step up in quality from the recent Coleman offerings. All in all, I like the tent. I find it well designed, well made, and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great size for two people (with room to spare)
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room at the head/foot of sleeping area for gear storage. Stayed totally dry and warm in 40F nights and scattered rain over the course of three days. Setup was easy and took around 10 minutes the first time taking it out. The floor is made out of the same nylon as the sides/top of the tent so you will need a ground cover/tarp. (I grabbed a 5x8 tarp for around $5 and it fits in the bag with the tent so this was no trouble).
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and a 5 star tent!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a great buy. I compared this to the REI tents that were on sale and appeared to be their cheapest but this tent was cheaper and very reliable keeping the wind out. I set this guy outside and slept in it for a couple nights and thought to myself "what a great buy". Definitely pick one up if you want to go camping with one other or yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Sport and Spine

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the tent is quite good and it's durable too. Its perfect for two person. I have used it for few scout camping trip with my son. Assembly was not that difficult, the only issue which we faced was with the tent steak as it was not sharp enough to go deep inside the soil. Luckily I had few extra pair of steak which I used to hook my tent. Overall it turned to be a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alok Ranjan

customer_reviews.title: Lasts years and all weather
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this tent for 4 years and it’s endured a huge dog, two toddlers, sand, freezing cold, torrential rain, salty air, and fit nicely in our child’s carryon. Cheap and tough little tent. Held two tall adults and a toddler with comfort, tight squeeze beyond the recommendation of two people, but fit all 4 of us and a dog well enough. Might buy the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: E. Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Hardy light tent
customer_reviews.text: My GF and I really love this tent. We have taken it on several camping trips now where we've encountered powerful winds, rain and hail, and The Meramac has done a good job at keeping us protected from all of it. My only gripe is that this tent does not come with a vestibule... which is now something ill be looking for when this one bites the dust. I am also very happy with the weight... at under 7 lbs, its pretty light for a 2x person camping tent.
customer_reviews.author: jake munoz

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great on this. Lots of room and a couple storage compartments. I used this in the rain for several days in a row and no complaints. The corners on the bottom did start to seep water a bit after sitting in a puddle but it was pretty much negligible. Do know that without the fly attached that there's just mesh on the sides it covers, there's no way to seal it up without the fly (look at the pictures)
customer_reviews.author: Jake O.

customer_reviews.title: Everything is perfect, quality zippers and material.
customer_reviews.text: Best tent ever. Got this on prime day, paid more for the 1 person tent earlier this year. This tent is only a few more pounds and is much roomier. I wish it had a larger screen area like the Lynx does. I spent 2 nights in the forest with 2 large thunderstorms and downpour. The side 3 inches was slightly exposed to the outside from under the rain fly and it was a bit damp, but for that serious of a rain I was really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Tycho

customer_reviews.title: Tent is super easy to put together and it's a great roomy ...
customer_reviews.text: Tent is super easy to put together and it's a great roomy tent even for two people. I'd say you could really fit 3 given how other companies rate a tent. I'm 6'4" as well and this tent is roomy for me and I don't have to sleep diagonial or feel my head/feet pressed into the tent wall. The rain fly does a great job of keeping you dry as well. **If you go camping in the cold/windy weather then you will probably feel it in this tent.
customer_reviews.author: J&S Griswell

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, lots of room but not lots of weight
customer_reviews.text: Although I was backpacking by myself I bought this 2 person tent for a Utah trip (for more space inside). It provides lots of room, easy to set up, take down, and pack, and isn't much heavier than a 1 person tent. A couple years ago I bought a 1 person ALPS tent , which I still have, and both are high quality.
customer_reviews.author: ICRR

customer_reviews.title: Great looking sturdy tent
customer_reviews.text: Super Sweet Tent. Took it to talledega to camp in the infield. It took two of us to set it up, and went up in less than 2-3 minutes. Really good looking tent, and the rain canopy didn't collect any water when it rained. Really sturdy feel to the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value for an almost 4-season tent
customer_reviews.text: It’s no Big Agnes but considering the value this is a 5 star tent for the money. We’ve camped in some decent size snow and rain storms in high altitudes and low. No leaks during the snow trips but it did leak after 2 days of heavy rain in Lassen National Park, mostly due to the fact it was sitting a big pool of water the whole time. That said, I would not do more than car camping with this guy in those types of situations and would much prefer a 4-season tent especially in the backcountry. But for less than $80 you get a lot for your money.
customer_reviews.author: I.M. Sirius

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now. I got one that sleeps 4 and loved it so much that I got this one too. Not the lightest tent so you might want to find something else for your backpacking trips. But this is sturdy and sets up in minutes. I put this thing through the ringer last summer, probably slept in it 30 times with my girlfriend and dog and it still feels brand new. The stakes are pretty cheap so I'd recommend getting better stakes. Outside of that, great tent for the value.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Kluge

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous for one person; 4 sided windows
customer_reviews.text: Really a one person tent if you want to store your gear in it with you but I love windows on all 4 sides plus a top vent; easy up and down (even for me, a female, who has never put a tent up before). Has a little mesh slot at the top for a wallet, glasses, valuables. I love it. Fabulous for the price!
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad tent ... But
customer_reviews.text: I got it pretty quickly (faster than even the site promised), I opened it out at home and therefore I don’t know how the tent will behave in action. Of the benefits: 1. not heavy, takes up little space 2. strong enough construction 3. just going 4. for several seasons (blown in summer and with a rain closure for autumn) 5. strong fasteners of the minuses (???): 1. glue / firmware ( afraid to let the water pass or it will quickly run out) 2. Only if you stretch the ropes will it be a tent for 2nd with backpacks 3. a little confusing mount for the top tent
customer_reviews.author: Miroslav

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, light enough for backpacking. Holds up to rain and sand fine - doesn't keep sand from blowing into tent though.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for two people! We love taking this out with us, and it is definitely light enough to take backpacking (might update later if we take it on a backpacking trip). So far it has stood up to rain and sand well and has kept us dry. I would note if you are camping on the beach, though, it will not keep sand from blowing into your tent. The grains of sand seemed to be fine enough to get through the mesh windows. Overall though a great tent.
customer_reviews.author: MotorcycleMan

customer_reviews.title: Great until it fails.
customer_reviews.text: Taken the tent on two outings this year. There is plenty of space for two people if you leave your gear outside. It performed very well in heavy rain (after scotch guarding it), My only complaint is that one of the poles strings snapped but after only having set it up twice that is a pretty big ding in my opinion. It didn't make it through the season.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were a little annoying, but I figured it out in the end. Once you figure it out. You will have this up in no time. This will hold 2 people, but till be a tight fit. It took a beating when I went camping because it rained for 2 days. I was dry as a bone.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Headberg

customer_reviews.title: My SOn loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is Very easy for my 12yo boy scout to setup and use by himself. we chose this 2 man tent so he would have space for his gear as opposed to those tents that are no bigger than a sleeping bag. The tent feel like a very high quality piece of gear and his first outing he was in the rain. Everything inside stayed dry!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: I stayed dry!
customer_reviews.text: This tent supplies a good amount of room for a 2-person tent. I used it for just myself (I'm 6'3 200#s), my 30 pound dog and her kennel. The setup was pretty easy for someone the doesn't camp much. Most importantly I stayed dry after a light rain.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and pretty roomie
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and pretty roomie. Although, like many tents that say they are "2-person" this tent would be a pretty tight fit for 2 people (which I was prepared for). Since it's usually just me in there it definitely does the trick. The rain fly did an excellent job keeping me dry.
customer_reviews.author: Allyson Salvucci

customer_reviews.title: Good little tent
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to assemble, especially being entirely clips without any of the slips to put the tent poles through. and the rainfly buckles in which is convenient. The entire tent seemed very sturdy except weirdly the bottom which seems like the most important part to be sturdy lol. The material was very very thin, but it wasn't the standard tarp and it did seem to hold up so I'm hoping whatever it is happens to be stronger so they just used less of it, optimism I guess..
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: good quality though in good weather
customer_reviews.text: I used this in high winds and it stayed up. It will leak and did. about time i took it on my trip and came home, it was too late to return. good quality though in good weather, light weight and compact which I like very much.
customer_reviews.author: rg

customer_reviews.title: Survived Rain, Wind, & Freezing Temps
customer_reviews.text: Was primitive camping in Ouachita National Forest in Arkansas for a few days and this tent took a beating. It packed nicely (for the price) and was able to keep me dry for two nights of rain. It was terribly windy one night but they tent felt study and was very roomy. Highly recommend if you are needing a budget backpacking/camping bag.
customer_reviews.author: The Man Behind The Pen

customer_reviews.title: Made for camping, not backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Took this on several camping trips over the summer. I did spray a waterproof coating on it (like I do with all my tents) and had absolutely no issue, even during horrible storms. It is definitely too big to take for a backpacking trip though.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN R FLAHERTY

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I've had.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Easy to assemble and easy to put away. Has endured rain and wind and has held up great. I love the double doors. Nothing bad to say about this tent. It has exceeded my expec7.
customer_reviews.author: Vera

customer_reviews.title: Took in water and failed when I needed it the most
customer_reviews.text: 1st day I used it rain heavy in the Gila I was on a wilderness hunt it leak thru maybe defective maybe i can get a replacement i will post video of water leaking in when raining it ended my elk hunt for now plan to go back if I can
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Right size for one person camping, keeps you dry.
customer_reviews.text: Like the 2-person size for 1-person tent camping. Kept me dry during a few rainy nights on recent 5-night motorcycle camping trip. A little bigger when packed than some tents. Also a little on the heavy side, but still was ok for packing on my motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: So Cal Guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent - easy set-up - great price
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent - easy set-up - great price. I only took off one star for ventilation, which could be better. It's hard to beat this price for a lightweight tent. There's plenty of room for 2 people and some extra bags/equipment inside. We are new to backpacking, so we didn't want to spend too much on our first tent. This worked out to be perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended and has the perfect amount of room!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great! I have used this tent a lot and I love it. Tons of room but pretty compact. You can fit an inflatable mattress in the tent perfectly (which is great because my girlfriend doesn't like using a sleeping pad) and if you use it for just yourself you can fit your pack and dog!
customer_reviews.author: Ian McAlister

customer_reviews.title: Both times I have used this in the rain I have slept like a baby straight through the night
customer_reviews.text: Made me and my cohabiter the dryest guys at the rainy event. Both times I have used this in the rain I have slept like a baby straight through the night. Was comparing to a ~30 USD option, def worth it for the two flaps and other features.
customer_reviews.author: Alden

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Compact. Fit a full air mattress in it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Compact. Fit a full air mattress in it. Kept bugs out. Sealed well. Like the windows with covers. Like the net overhead to put iPad for watching movies laying down and looking up. Stayed dried
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent!
customer_reviews.text: I travel for disc golf tourneys and camping is the best way to go. I set up this tent easily & quickly in a light rain. There was major down pour all night and the tent held up perfectly. I was warm and dry all night.
customer_reviews.author: Certified buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent. Two doors, lots of windows, pockets to put your stuff away. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Great tent that came highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent on the recommendation of a friend who uses one in Colorado in all different conditions. I did a backyard water test with the rain fly on and it seems to stay very dry inside. Have not tested it in windy conditions yet.
customer_reviews.author: Frank LiBretto

customer_reviews.title: Great for scouts
customer_reviews.text: Got this tent as a lightweight option for both car camping and backpacking. Very happy. Fits me and my gear or two people if you are willing to leave your gear outside your tent (necessary in some situations). Very simple to setup and tear down and durable so far. For scouting this is a great option for troops who are looking for quality lightweight tents that are a step up from entry level tents.
customer_reviews.author: John Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Cozy Toasty!
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this tent. Easy to set up and break down, plenty of space, and very light to carry. My 13 year old dog LOVES it and gets all worked up every time she sees me start setting up camp! Grab one and get outside, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lee

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed and Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great-- plenty of ventilation so condensation doesn't build on the walls, well placed windows for a nice view in the morning, and it's easy to put up. Great all around tent! I suggest using with a tarp underneath to prevent any sticks from poking through.
customer_reviews.author: W. Litchfield

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product...
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a sleepover hike in the Colorado mountains. We camped at about 12k feet in mid summer. Through the night we encountered high winds and rain. The tent held up beautifully without a drop inside. My boyfriend and I both slept in this in our mummy sleeping bags and found it even a bit too warm. I would highly recommend buying this tent especially for the weight, space and durability for the price range!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive tent
customer_reviews.text: Good tent. It's definitely only going to fit 2 sleeping bags and very little else floor-wise; I bought it for just myself and I wouldn't really want to share! The fabric isn't as sturdy as I've seen on other more expensive tents, but it's not falling apart by any means, and if you want the more expensive fabric then go buy a more expensive tent lol. Overal good purchase for casual summer use.
customer_reviews.author: Margeau Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: Just used this last night. I liked the tent! It's easy to put up and is has enough space for me and my friend who is 6'6. Putting our bags in the tent was pushing it. The temp was in the 20's and it got pretty cold in the tent. And it's kinda heavy for backpacking. But overall a solid tent for spring and summer. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tent. Not super lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tent. Not super lightweight, but it doesn't leak and it's a snap to put up. Fits three sleeping pads squeezed in for small people. I take it with my two kids and dog and we fit okay, but two full sized adults would have some room.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Wright

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to put up and take down
customer_reviews.text: I was able to assemble this on my own on my first camping trip. Super easy to put up and take down. Perfect for two people; my husband and I can just barely fit our Queen-size air mattress in ours.
customer_reviews.author: AddyB

customer_reviews.title: Camping - YES; Backpacking - NO
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great tent, but I do NOT recommend it for backpacking. It is 6lbs in weight, which makes it very heavy for backpacking. For regular camping it is a nice tent that is very easy to put up.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyanne Farr

customer_reviews.title: Good spacesaver in the pack
customer_reviews.text: Set-up was fairly easy, even after a long hike in. We did a setup in the yard a couple fo days before we went to make sure all was well and familiar. It packs light and tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have used this tent a few times. I'm 6'2" and 265lbs. We fit in this high quality tent without being cramped. It is also super light.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFreak7395

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: Little smaller that I expected it to be. The tent has great airflow and is perfect for summer camping. Held up really well in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Katja S.

customer_reviews.title: Backpacking tent for two and dog
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a backpacking tent with room for gear and a dog and this fits the bill. Easy to set up, good protection from overhang even when windows open in rain. Design flaw is when you open the door the wet door falls into the tent so you have to tie it back. Happy with tent.
customer_reviews.author: druidwood

customer_reviews.title: Good for tall people.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the money. I researched like every other backpack under 100 dollars. Very nice quality I was impressed. I’m 6ft 2 fit perfectly. That’s why I bought this as most are shorter than 7.5 ft Long. If your 6ft or over and want a tent for under like 200 dollars or more, get this tent or like the Taurus or lynx that are like 95 bucks or something.this seems like a solid company. Alps mountaineering for the win will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: isaac

customer_reviews.title: but instead I had to take it out of the cover and hope that it didn't get too dirty. Overall
customer_reviews.text: I was under the impression this was a lightweight 'backpacking' tent, but it's just a regular tent. I wish the cover was more backpack friendly, but instead I had to take it out of the cover and hope that it didn't get too dirty. Overall, good tent.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Jinski

customer_reviews.title: It's super easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: It's super easy to set up, I just wish I could zip up the windows on the side (it's mesh). I used it for backpacking as a beginner, and I think it was a bit heavy for a first-timer. It'd be a good idea to bring a tarp to place underneath the tent since the material is soft and water could probably seep through. I do like how spacious it is.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie A.

customer_reviews.title: Decent tent
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little heavy for hiking but I knew that so I’m not disappointed. My only issue is that the side openings are a little weird. I think I just need to get used it. But it’s so far a solid overall tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer O.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent !  Great price👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the price you can't beat it looks good easy to set up have used it a couple of times already this year very pleased with it
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Berry

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price and no bad weather.
customer_reviews.text: Small tent. Easy to set up and pack in. It’s pretty fragile. And there isn’t room to do anything but sleep in it. AND if you are 6’1” like me, you’ll be sleeping diagonally
customer_reviews.author: Megan Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little tent. It is small but big enough for two people. It withstood a wind storm in the mountains. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Seam split
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for a 3 day backpacking trip in Colorado. The weight was great and it was roomy enough for both of us and our sleeping systems. Unfortunately on the last morning we had found the seam split at the front door zipper during the night. It was windy that night but I hoped the tent would be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: austin goff

customer_reviews.title: Great value and well made tent.
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent on a 5 day Montana rafting trip. Easy to set up. Well built and didn't have any condensation nor leak issues when it rained.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be more pleased
customer_reviews.text: Great tent easy to assemble. Great durability. Light weight included.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: 1 disappointment so far
customer_reviews.text: Have not taken it out yet. But will be tested in 2 wks. My only disappointment is the rain fly does not go down the sides like in the photo. Maybe that won't be a problem. I gave a 3 star only because I haven't "used" it yet
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Swanson

customer_reviews.title: very good purchase
customer_reviews.text: My teen daughter loved it and went for her scout campout this weekend. Its her first own tent.
customer_reviews.author: Geetha

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Easy to disassemble. I took it camping about a month ago and lightly rained in one of the nights I camped out and it did its job. I was happy about that. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Krieger vs Big Brother

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and take down
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and take down. Little features like the quick disconnects for rain fly, nice touch. Quality product and it even easily fits back into bag :-)
customer_reviews.author: April Price

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Easy to use and long enough for me to sleep comfortably. I am 6'5" and I have extra room at my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Held up great on a week trip to UP Michigan. great breathability and fairly light weight. I only used this for a one person tent. Had one night of a rainstorm and i didnt wake up wet so thats a good sign. A great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: justin stoffer

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need from a tent.
customer_reviews.text: This tent was easy to set up, didn't leak at all despite it raining like crazy, and fit two people easily without us kicking each other in our sleep or anything. Having doors on both sides was also very convenient for sharing it without having to crawl over each other.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for an easy tent that was a good size for me and ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a tight squeeze for two people. However, I knew that when I made the purchase. I was looking for an easy tent that was a good size for me and my gear. For that, this tent is perfect. On Boy Scout campouts I sometimes use a cot, which is a tight fit in this tent. I love the quality of Alps gear and the lifetime warranty is a comfort. Would have given it 5 stars but the clips that hold the fly in place do not always stay tight. I would not hesitate to purchase another one of these if needed.
customer_reviews.author: VAHusker

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Great price for the quality of the tent. I used it for just myself and it is very comfortable for 1 person. Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy the simplicity of the set up and tear down ...
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the simplicity of the set up and tear down of this tent, and it is a perfect size for back country packing for myself and my girlfriend. The one thing I do not like is that the side windows (screens) do not close up so you constantly have the potential for cold air to come in. Other than that, it is great!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bigger

customer_reviews.title: Great 2-Person Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Very good 2 person tent. Set up was fast and easy / break done was just the same. We carried this from the states to Iceland in our suitcase without an issue. So it is light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love! 💝
customer_reviews.text: I adore my Meramac! It is worth every one of the 6 pounds in my pack. On several occasions I’ve stayed warm and dry during wind and rain.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Bacca

customer_reviews.title: Averall decent tent, totally worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed a lot of camping in this tent. It is way bigger than I thought, so plenty of room to move around. Easy to set up. Not insulated very well.
customer_reviews.author: octav

customer_reviews.title: Worked put great for me love the two doors
customer_reviews.text: A couple very very small leaks when I was in constant rain for 6 days ! Worked put great for me love the two doors

customer_reviews.title: Pole broke on day 3 of a 7 day hiking trip.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent for a week long hiking trip. Did well with rain and the tent is easy to put up and take down. However after the 3 night, the pole broke. Then unfortunately I was 1 day past Amazon's 30 day return policy, and now cant even return or exchange the item.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: I put this up in pitch black darkness one handed just to prove how easy it was
customer_reviews.text: Most user friendly tent I have ever had or seen. I put this up in pitch black darkness one handed just to prove how easy it was.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Withstood the ravages of an outdoor music festival!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used the tent over the long Memorial Day weekend, and it worked like a champ! Nice product- great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Rick D.

customer_reviews.title: Love it

customer_reviews.author: Wayne dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for two. Used in RMNP during the rain. Just a bit heavy.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Slept in this thing every day for about a month. Never had any leaks and the bag that came with made it easy to carry. Wouldn't suggest for winter though.

customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and take down. Nice compact size for camping out of the trunk of my Miata. Just the right size for one and gear.

customer_reviews.title: It seems like a good tent
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a good tent, but I'm pretty sure mine was "used" since it contained pine needles and other debris.

customer_reviews.text: I love this tent! Works great! Doors on both sides. Zippered windows. Stash pockets. Best of all? It fits back in the bag!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the money. Decent weight and performance. Good bang for the buck.

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: Quick solo setup. Durable. This was home sweet home for few weeks thru Arizona, Utah, and Colorado, without a doubt the best tent I’ve ever camped in. NO COMPLAINTS! I will recommend this tent to anyone and everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up. Takes longer to set it up than it does to tear it down. The two door setup is nice to have and if you don't set up the fly, the airflow is great. Excellent value, it is well worth more!
customer_reviews.author: Rogelio Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great 2-person tent!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this tent and am so excited to try it out! It will easily fit two people. My husband is 6' and I'm 5' 8", and there's definitely room to spare. It was super simple and quick to set up. Lots of places to hang items inside. It's on the heavier side for backpacking, but couldn't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: bought for a 4 day excursion, 2 people. easy to set up, sturdy, not the lightest tent in the world, but a great starter for the price. Id replace the stakes with something lighter though. if you enjoy backpacking as a hobby you cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Camped out in 19 degree weather, it did fine. Next trip it rained for 12 solid hours. Both times I slept snug as a bug in a rug.
customer_reviews.author: gene ballew jr.

customer_reviews.title: great price for a good tent
customer_reviews.text: works well, especially for the price. would prefer something a little lighter and that took up less space, but then I'd have to pay a lot more. happy with this purchase for sure
customer_reviews.author: James415

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap because it's heavy, not because it's flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent for the price. If you are looking around at other tents and find them to be much more expensive understand it is because of a difference in weight, not quality. In backpacking, a tent over 3ish pounds is considered too heavy, this one is 7ish. So you would buy this tent because either you'll use it for backpacking and don't mind the weight or because you intend on using it for car or boat camping instead. I use it for backpacking and I am very satisfied with it. It has been through rain many times and I've never had any problems. At 70 dollars a problem free tent is quite impressive, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: T C

customer_reviews.title: Well made and versatile tent!
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this tent for 3yrs now and take it camping and to swim meets. This tent easy to set up, the carry bag is roomy enough for easy packing and storage. The two doors make it convenient. Buy this tent, you will not regret it!!!

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, simple and functional
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this tent. Has double doors which is what all tents should have. This has to be the easiest tent to put up which is an important trait to me. I hate when things are a pain in the @$$ when they don't have to be. I only wish they offered the Meramac 2 in the Outfitter series to get the thicker floor but so far a cheap ground tarp has been working fine.
